newsitem.title: FRANCE: Chirac says EU budget pact possible in Amsterdam.
newsitem.headline: Chirac says EU budget pact possible in Amsterdam.

text.p: French President Jacques Chirac said on Wednesday he believed that a budget stability pact could be signed at a European Union summit in Amsterdam next week.

"I want it and hope for it and, to tell the truth, I believe so," Chirac told reporters when asked if the pact on deficit control after the launch of the euro single currency could be signed at the Amsterdam summit on June 16-17.
Chirac met reporters after talks with British Prime Minister Tony Blair at the presidential Elysee Palace.
"The stability and growth pact...is needed if we want a stable single currency, without anyone hurting others with inconsidered actions," Chirac said.
But, he added, the financial side of European economic and monetary union should be balanced with concern for EU citizens.
"Europe is not only a financial or monetary issue, even if these issues are capital. Europe is also men and women who must be taken into account," he said.
